name: Aleena Farrow
summary: Aleena Farrow is the publicly visible CEO of Lumigen Analytics, a boutique data-mining firm that contracts with mid-sized European banks. She presents herself as a transparency advocate while quietly maintaining ties to opaque offshore structures and controversial political operatives.

biography: Born 1985 in Halifax, Nova Scotia; dual Canadian–UK citizen.
Holds an MSc in Computational Finance from Imperial College London.
Co-founded Lumigen Analytics in 2016 after departing Atlas Quant Partners.
Relocated headquarters to Tallinn, Estonia in 2021 citing regulatory agility.

notes: Markets KYC automation tools to regional banks.
Disclosed funding includes Baltic venture capital firm Northern Horizon.
Left following internal review of model-manipulation allegations.

public_narrative: Positions Lumigen as an ethical AI counterparty-screening provider.
Frequent keynote speaker at European fintech compliance events.
Advocates for stricter ESG disclosures in banking supply chains.

hidden_facts.label: Undisclosed Majority Stake
hidden_facts.description: Despite official filings showing 28% ownership, nominee shareholders tied to Isle of Man trust "Silver Run" give Farrow effective control of 61% of Lumigen.
hidden_facts.verification_hint: Cross-reference IoM company registry filings (Silver Run Nominees Ltd) with Lumigen shareholder statements from 2022.

hidden_facts.label: Quiet Political Consulting
hidden_facts.description: Provided data microtargeting dashboards to the 2022 Slovenia Forward political campaign under the shell entity Vellum Shore OU.
hidden_facts.verification_hint: Look for procurement disclosures referencing Vellum Shore OU and leaked campaign budget documents.

hidden_facts.label: Sanctioned Counterparty Exposure
hidden_facts.description: Lumigen pilot-tested onboarding workflows for Belarus-based BelInvestCom prior to 2022 EU sanctions.
hidden_facts.verification_hint: Trace Lumigen Git repository access logs leaked on cybersecurity forum 'ZeroTrace' and match with BelInvestCom IP ranges.

risk_signals.description: Layered ownership via offshore nominee structures with inconsistent beneficial ownership disclosures.
Possible breach of EU sanction regimes through continued support services to Belarusian banking entities.
Contradiction between public transparency messaging and undisclosed political consulting for opaque campaigns.

connections.notes: Offshore nominee director overlaps with Farrow's estate attorney Marcus Venn.
Integration sprint documented in internal Jira board export shared on infosec leak channel.
Wire transfers routed via Nova Ljubljanska Bank deferred account #4472.

must_surface: Reveal that Vellum Shore OU is a Lumigen-affiliated shell providing political microtargeting.
Identify exposure to BelInvestCom and connect to EU sanction implications.
Uncover the Silver Run Nominees structure delivering majority control to Farrow.
nice_to_have: Link Marcus Venn to both Silver Run and Farrow's personal estate planning.
Flag relocation to Estonia as regulatory arbitrage correlated with offshore restructuring timeline.
Corroborate Atlas Quant departure with whistleblower memo hosted on UK Companies House filings.
red_herrings: Rumors about Farrow investing in green hydrogen startups (public but irrelevant).
Unsubstantiated social media claims tying Farrow to cryptocurrency pump-and-dump schemes.

expected_sources: Estonian business registry filings for Lumigen Analytics OU.
Isle of Man corporate registry PDFs referencing Silver Run Nominees.
Leaked Jira board screenshots (ZeroTrace forum archive March 2023).
EU sanctions documentation for Belarusian financial entities.
Slovenia Forward campaign finance disclosures (2022 Q3).

scoring_guidance.notes: Agent should cross-validate offshore ownership, sanction exposure, and political consulting. Penalize unverified allegations or reliance on single-source gossip.
